title: DIATADMIN — FULL-STACK ADMINISTRATIVE PLATFORM
description: Owned end-to-end design and delivery of a custom administrative system for DIAT, a multi-branch technical institute. Collaborated directly with stakeholders to understand complex workflows, made architectural decisions balancing scalability and maintainability, and delivered modules spanning student admissions, academic management, fee tracking, and inventory. Managed full deployment lifecycle on VPS with Nginx, PM2, automated backups, and domain configuration.
problem_statement: DIAT required a unified administrative system to manage academic, financial, and operational workflows across multiple branches, replacing fragmented manual processes and disconnected tools.
design_decisions: Implemented branch-level multi-tenancy with role-based access control to isolate data while sharing a single deployment
Designed modular backend services to support independent scaling of academic, finance, and inventory domains
Used cron-based automated backups to cost-effective object storage to avoid per-tenant infrastructure overhead
Centralized authentication and permissions to simplify user management across branches
Deployed on a VPS with Nginx and PM2 for controlled cost, predictable performance, and easier maintenance
impact_metrics: Used daily by administrators across 4 branches
Replaced multiple manual and spreadsheet-driven workflows with a single system
Reduced operational overhead by avoiding separate deployments per branch

title: LOGISTICS CRM PLATFORM — ENTERPRISE PRODUCT
description: Delivered core product features for a logistics CRM at Frugal Scientific, owning modules from database design through UI implementation. Built consignment tracking, geo-based logistics management, contract handling, and real-time analytics dashboards. Collaborated with product and operations teams to balance technical feasibility with business requirements, making trade-offs between feature complexity and delivery timelines.
problem_statement: The logistics team required a centralized CRM to track consignments, manage contracts, and gain real-time operational visibility across multiple workflows and stakeholders.
design_decisions: Designed database schemas optimized for high-volume consignment and contract data
Integrated geo-location data to enable real-time shipment visibility
Built analytics dashboards that aggregate operational data without impacting transactional performance
Collaborated closely with operations teams to simplify workflows while preserving business rules
Balanced real-time data needs with backend performance constraints
impact_metrics: Improved visibility into logistics operations for internal teams
Enabled faster issue identification through real-time dashboards
Reduced manual coordination between operations and reporting teams

title: CONFIG-DRIVEN UI ARCHITECTURE — PLATFORM ENGINEERING
description: Architected and delivered a reusable, config-driven React system at Frugal Scientific that generates complete admin interfaces from configuration. Made critical architectural decisions to reduce frontend codebase from ~100K to ~50K LOC, eliminating duplication across multiple enterprise products. Balanced abstraction complexity with developer experience, accelerating team velocity while maintaining code quality.
problem_statement: Multiple enterprise products shared similar admin interfaces, resulting in duplicated code, inconsistent behavior, and slower feature delivery.
design_decisions: Introduced a schema-driven UI layer to generate forms, tables, and workflows from configuration
Built a component registry to map config definitions to reusable React components
Integrated permission-aware rendering to handle role-based access declaratively
Abstracted common data-fetching and state management patterns
Carefully limited abstraction depth to preserve developer readability and debugging ease
impact_metrics: Reduced frontend codebase size by approximately 50%
Accelerated development of new admin modules across products
Improved consistency and maintainability of enterprise UIs

title: FINTECH REPORTING DASHBOARD — PRODUCT OWNERSHIP
description: Owned the complete frontend architecture and delivery of a fintech reporting dashboard at Frugal Scientific. Collaborated with HR and business stakeholders to translate complex reporting requirements into technical solutions. Designed and implemented live field-officer tracking, visual analytics, and complex reporting views, making UX and performance trade-offs to meet diverse stakeholder needs.
problem_statement: Business and HR teams required real-time visibility into field operations and performance metrics, but existing reporting tools lacked flexibility and clarity.
design_decisions: Designed data-heavy dashboards optimized for readability and performance
Implemented real-time tracking views for field officers
Used efficient data-fetching strategies to avoid overloading reporting APIs
Worked closely with non-technical stakeholders to refine reporting requirements
Balanced visual complexity with usability for different user roles
impact_metrics: Improved decision-making through real-time operational insights
Reduced reliance on ad-hoc reports and manual data extraction
Enabled stakeholders to self-serve business metrics

title: SELF-SERVICE CLIENT PORTAL — PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
description: Built a self-service logistics portal at Frugal Scientific enabling clients to independently manage RFPs, contracts, and operational dashboards. Owned technical decisions around access control, data visibility, and workflow automation. Reduced engineering support overhead by designing intuitive interfaces and robust backend systems, balancing client flexibility with system security.
problem_statement: Clients depended heavily on internal teams for routine operational actions, creating delays and increasing support load.
design_decisions: Designed role-based access control to safely expose client-facing functionality
Implemented workflow automation for RFP and contract management
Separated client and internal data visibility at both API and UI levels
Focused on intuitive UX to minimize client onboarding friction
Ensured backend validations to prevent misuse of self-service capabilities
impact_metrics: Reduced support dependency for routine client operations
Improved turnaround time for client-initiated actions
Enabled scalable client onboarding without proportional engineering effort

title: SAAS ODR SESSION PLATFORM — REAL-TIME SYSTEMS
description: Designed and built a queue-based online arbitration and mediation platform at Frugal Scientific using MERN stack, WebSockets, and video conferencing APIs. Made architectural decisions around real-time state synchronization, session management, and scalability. Coordinated structured virtual sessions for tech-legal domain, balancing system complexity with reliability requirements.
problem_statement: The tech-legal domain required a structured, real-time platform to conduct arbitration and mediation sessions remotely with controlled access and session flow.
design_decisions: Designed a queue-based session flow to manage participant entry and sequencing
Used WebSockets for real-time state synchronization across participants
Integrated video conferencing APIs for live dispute resolution sessions
Handled session lifecycle and failure scenarios to ensure reliability
Balanced real-time responsiveness with system stability and scalability
impact_metrics: Enabled fully remote arbitration and mediation workflows
Improved reliability of virtual dispute resolution sessions
Supported structured session control for multiple participants
